properties.descript2: Caesar leaves camp at the Axona River and moves to the territory of the Suessiones and reaches the city of Noviodunum after a day's march
the Bellovaci supposedly retreated to their town of Bratuspantium - Caesar moves from Noviodunum to Bartuspantium

Caesar moves from Bratuspantium to the territory of the Ambiani -  on a map in Raaflaub 2017, p. 65 it is suggested Caesar moves to Samarobriva (the main town of the Ambiani), but this is not explicitly mentioned in the BG
Caesar moves three days through the territory of the Nervii and makes camp some 10 miles from the Sabis river (here, the location chosen is the battlefield on the Selle cf. Livius.org)

Nervii made a battleline an the other side of the Sabis, the Atrebates and Viromandui and the Atuatuci are also present (and one could assume, have come from their respective territories - for the Sabis location, Livius.org is consulted) - Nervii

Nervii made a battleline an the other side of the Sabis, the Atrebates and Viromandui and the Atuatuci are also present (and one could assume, have come from their respective territories - for the Sabis location, Livius.org is consulted) - Atrebates

Nervii made a battleline an the other side of the Sabis, the Atrebates and Viromandui and the Atuatuci are also present (and one could assume, have come from their respective territories - for the Sabis location, Livius.org is consulted) - Viromandui

Nervii made a battleline an the other side of the Sabis, the Atrebates and Viromandui and the Atuatuci are also present (and one could assume, have come from their respective territories - for the Sabis location, Livius.org is consulted) - Atuatuci

Caesar moves from winter quarters in the territory of the Sequani (Vesontio was the main town, cf. 1.38.1) to the territory of the Belgae, reaching the border after 15 days. 2.3.1 - diplomatic envoys are send to Caesar by the Remi, so possibly Caesar ent

Caesar sends 1 legion led by Publiuc Crassus from his position (town of Atuatuci - here Thuin cf.  Buijtendorp 2018, pp. 152-154) to the Veneti, Venelli, Osismi, Curiosolites, Esubii, Aulerci, and Redones on the coast of Gaul in the west
Potential troopmovement of Diviciacus and the Aedui from Caesar's camp in the territory of the Remi (possiblt Durocortorum)  to the territory of the Bellovaci
Caesar moves from the territory of the Remi (possibly Durocortorum) across the river Axona and makes camp on the other side of the river
Caesar sends auxiliary troops from his camp on the Axona river to Bibrax
Caesar sends the 12th legion from the town of the Atuatuci southward, to the territory of the Nantuantes, Veragri, and Seduni, and the village Octodurus, to secure a route through the Alps

NULLTitus Labienus with a contigent of cavalry is dispatched to the territory of the Treveri from Caesar's position in the territory of the Veneti / lower Liger river (3.9.1-3) - Nantes (Civitas Namnetum) is used as starting point.

Caesar moves from the territory of the Veneti to the those of the Morini and Menapii - Raaflaub 2017, p. 105 suggests from Portus Namnetum (a 3rd c. CE name),  possibly the lower Liger river. End point is rough estimate (inland Duinkerke/Calais)

From the territory of the Morini and Menapii (here used as starting point - lower Scheldt river area) Caesar moves to winterquarters in the territory of the Aulerci and other tribes bordering the zone of recent conflict

From the territory of the Morini and Menapii (here used as starting point - vicinity lower Scheldt area) Caesar moves to winterquarters in the territory of the Lexovii and other tribes bordering the zone of recent conflict
12th legion leaves the village Octodurus after a battle and moves towards the territory of the Nantuates and Allobroges

Usipetes cross the Rhine in large numbers (not far from where the river flows into the sea) to the territory of the Menapii, being chased by the Suebi. This record uses Pleiades coordinates for the territories of the Usipetes.

Tencteri cross the Rhine in large numbers (not far from where the river flows into the sea) to the territory of the Menapii, being chased by the Suebi. This record uses Pleiades coordinates for the territories of the Tencteri.

Usipetes and Tencteri cross the Rhine in large numbers (not far from where the river flows into the sea) to the territory of the Menapii, being chased by the Suebi; This record follows Roymans 2018, p. 168 reconstruction.

Caesar moves from the territory of the Eburones/Condrusi to the Rhine/Mosel area camping 8 miles from where these rivers come together (4.15.2). Mosa is interpreted as Mosalle cf. Raaflaub 2017, p. 116
Caesar moves from the territory of the Eburones/Condrusi to the region in the vicinity of Druten, between Meuse and Waal rivers, cf. Roymans 2018, p. 170
Caesar moves from his camp 8 miles towards the confluence of Rhine and Mosel and massacres the Tencteri/Usipetes
Caesar moves from his camp 8 miles towards the camp of the Tencteri/Usipetes, at Kessel, Lith, Rossum, and massacres the Germans, cf. Roymans 2018, p. 170

Cavalry of Usipetes and Tencteri cross the Rhine from the territory of the Ambivariti into the area of the Sugambri (with whom they ally); The reconstruction is based of the location for the Ambivirati and Sugambri in Roymans 2018

Caesar moves with his armies from the camp close to the Usipeten/Tencteri massacre to the territory of the Ubii to build a bridge across the Rhine there. Location bridge cf. Ipshording 1886/DARE 44552; Holmes 1911, p. 710 for discussion

Caesar moves from his camp near Druten (Roymans 2018) to the territory of the Ubii and builds a bridge across the Rhine. Location bridge cf. Ipshording 1886/DARE 44552; Holmes 1911, p. 710 for discussion
Usipetes/Tencteri cross the Rhine and Meuse in South-Holland and move to a site near Kessel/Lith/Rossum, where Waal flows into the Meuse; cf. Roymans 2018, p. 168

Caesar moves from the first bridge through the area of the Ubii towards the area of the Sugambri. The latter's location cf. Roymans 2018, p. 168 (Pleiades location erroneous); Bridge cf. Ipshording 1886/DARE 44552; Holmes 1911 for discussion
Caesar pulls out of the area of the Sugambri towards the first bridge, which he demolishes; Sugambri cf. Roymans 2018, p. 168; Bridge cf. Ipshording 1886/DARE 44552
Caesar moves from the first bridge towards the area of the Morini (location inland Calais/Duinkerke to correct Pleiades) to cross the North Sea towards Britain
legions are dispatched from the area of the Morini towards the area of the Menapii (lower Scheldt area) and those areas of the Morini which failed to send envoys to Caesar

Cavalry is send from the central harbour in the territory of the Morini (Portus Itius - Boulogne-sur-Mer) to the other harbour (Ambleteuse) at 8 miles distance; cf. Raaflaub 2017, p. 123; Keune, 1916, RE IX, p. 2367; see also Smith 1854, 'Portus Itius'
Usipetes/Tencteri move from the territory of the Menapii to those of the Eburones/Condrusi (clients of the Treveri)
Caesar moves to the Rhine to campaign against the Germans, possibly from Samarobriva (3.28-29) to the Eburones (Raaflaub 2017, p. 111; Pleiades location for Eburones)
Caesar moves to the Rhine to campaign against the Germans, possibly from Samarobriva (3.28-29) to the Eburones (Raaflaub 2017, p. 111; Roymans 2018, p. 168 for location Eburones)
Caesar moves from Portus Itius to the territory of the Treveri with 4 lightly equipped legions and 800 cavalry
Caesar returns from Britain (in the harbours of Portus Itius? This is not mentioned in text) and organizes a meeting in Samarobriva
Legion under Gaius Fabius moves to the territory of the Morini (from Samarobriva?)

Legion under Lucius Roscius moves to the territory of the Esubii (from Samarobriva?); Esubii as Sagii (Pleiades 109301/Bertaux 1976, 'SAGII (Sées) Dept. Orne, France.', PECS) and location is Noiodounon (69538), which was supposedly their main city.
Legion under Quintus Cicero moves to the territory of the Nervii (from Samarobriva?)

Legion under Titus Labienus moves to the territory of the Remi, on the edge of the territory of the Treveri (from Samarobriva?); Wintercamp Labienus: the site at Mouzon (Pleiades 109183 - Mosomagus); see Holmes 1911, pp. 105, 383-384, 732-734

From the area north of the Po river a legion plus 5 cohorts under Quintus Titurius Sabinus and Lucius Aurunculeius Cotta moves to the area of the territory of the Eburones, who mosly live between Meuse and Rhine and have Ambiorix and Catuvolcus as kings.
Indutiomarus has all non-combatants retreat from the area of the Treveri to the Ardennes
Cavalry of Ambiorix moves from the battlefield at the Roman camp in the territory of the Eburones to the territory of the Atuatuci
Cavalry of Ambiorix moves from the territory of the Atuatuci to the territory of the Nervii
Armies of Atuatuci lay siege to the winterquarters of Quintus Cicero in the territory of the Nervii
Armies of Eburones lay siege to the winterquarters of Quintus Cicero in the territory of the Nervii
Legions of Marcus Crassus in the territory of the Bellovaci move to the position of Caesar (possibly in Samarobriva)
Legions of Gaius Fabius move from the territory of the Morini to the territory of the Atrebates
Caesar moves with his legions from Samarobriva in the direction of the territory of the Nervii
Caesar moves his legions from the area of the Treveri to Portus Itius
Indutiomarus and his troops retreat from the camp of Labienus in the territory of the Remi to the territory of the Treveri

Armoricans assemble forces and approach the camp of Lucius Roscius in the territory of the Esubii. Afterwards they disband and spread out. Esubii here as Sagii, with their their location the town of Noiodounon (Pleiades 109301; 69538; Bertaux 1976, PECS)
The king of the Aedui Dumnorix flees from Portus Itius and Caesar's cavalry pursuits in the direction of his home territory (of the Aedui?)

the Suebi retreat with their army to the farthest part of their territory, in a forest named Bacenis. The Suebi position is roughly set N of Frankfurt towards the Weser; The forest is identified as the Harz region, cf. Dietz 2006, 'Silva Bacenis', DNP
Caesar retreats over the second bridge from the territory of the Ubii.
After crossing the second bridge, Caesar sends cavalry funder Lucius Minucius Basilus through the Ardennes to the territory of the Eburones, in pursuit of Ambiorix
Caesar moves with four legions from the (surroundings of) Samarobriva to the territory of the Nervii.
Caesar moves with four legions from the territory of the Nervii to the (surroundings of) Samarobriva.
Caesar moves from Samarobriva to Lutetia (presumably accompanied by his legions) to conduct a concilium/meeting there
Caesar moves from Lutetia to the territory of the Senones.
Caesar moved with his legions from the territory of the Ubii and the second bridge towards Atuatuca, in the centre of the territory of the Eburones
Caesar sends Titus Labienus with three legions from Atuatuca towards the oceaan, to the areas which bordered the territory of the Menapii; is to return after 7 days
Caesar sends Gaius Trebonius with three legions from Atuatuca to the area bordering on the territory of the Atuatuci; to return after 7 days
Caesar moves with three legions from Atuatuca to the Sabis river and the farthest parts of the Ardennes forest; returns after 7 days

The Sugambri marshall 2000 cavalrymen and cross the Rhine 30 miles upstream of the second bridge in the territory of the Ubii. The crossing point is arbitrarily taken c. 30 miles upstream of the Rhine in the vicinity of Oberwesel Dörscheid.
The Sugambri move with 2000 cavalry from the Rhine crossing in the direction of the territory of the Eburones, move through the forests to continue towards Atuatuca (3 days distance)

Germans retreat from Atuatuca towards the Rhine. For the crossing point is taken c. 30 miles upstream of the Rhine in the vicinity of Oberwesel Dörscheid. This point is rather arbitrarily chosen. See also 6.35-7
Caesar returns with his legions at Atuatuca from the farthest parts of the Ardennes forest; returns after 7 days.
Caesar moves from Atuatuca into the territory of the Eburones, destroying each village and building - search and destroy / scourged earth policy
Caesar retreats from the territory of the Eburones after the pursuit of Ambiorix to  Durocortorum
two legions are send to the winterquarters in the territory of the Lingones (from Durocortorum ?).
two legions are dispatched (from Durocortorum ?) to the winterquarters on the border of the territory of the Treveri.
six legions are dispatched (from Durocortorum ?) to the winterquarters in the territory of the Sesones, in the town of Agedincum

From the territory of the Senones Caesar sends the army bunch and two legions to Labienus who had wintercamp in the territory of the Treveri (although probably on the very edge of the territory of the Remi, bordering on Treveri territory)
Caesar moves with seven legions from the territory of the Senones to the territory of the Menapii
Caesar moves from the territory of the Menapii to the territory of the Treveri

the Treveri assemble an army and move towards the winterquarters of Labienus (which was situated on the border of the territory of the Treveri in the territory of the Remi - 5.24.2), make camp at 15 miles distance

Caesar arrives from the territory of the Menapii in the territory of the Treveri and constructs a second bridge to cross the Rhine. Location between Koblenz - Andernach (Holmes 1911, p. 710) or Weissenthurm - Urmitz (Raaflaub 2017, p. 180)
After constructing a second bridge across the Rhine, Caesar crosses the Rhine and enters the territory of the Ubii
Nervii deliver troops to the Gaulisch army at Alesia
Mediomatrici deliver troops to the Gaulisch army at Alesia.
Morini deliver troops to the Gaulisch army at Alesia
Atrebates deliver troops to the Gaulisch army at Alesia.
Caesar moves from the territory of the Suessiones to the territory of the Eburones (where he applies a scourged earth policy of burning buildings and settlements)
Legions under Labienus are send to the territory of the Treveri from the territory of the Suessiones.
Gaius Fabius is dispatched with two legions to the territory of the Suessiones. According to Raaflaub 2017, p. 149, he was stationed among the Remi before moving.
